roleset.name: make very angry, extreme, causing outrage (or other extreme feeling)

example.name: ARG1
example.text: Sen. Lloyd Bentsen -LRB- D. , Texas -RRB- was outraged after a private word to John Motley , lobbyist for the National Federation of Independent Business , resulted in a news release saying that the Senate Finance Committee chairman would recommend repeal of Section 89 .
example.arg: after a private word to John Motley , lobbyist for the National Federation of Independent Business , resulted in a news release saying that the Senate Finance Committee chairman would recommend repeal of Section 89

example.name: outrageous-j: both args, empty it
example.text: The Garrisonians had usually found more support in Scotland and it was outrageous to them that Pennington should be poaching ontheir territory.
example.arg: that Pennington should be poaching ontheir territory.

roleset.note: OUTRAGE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'outrage' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entry 31.1 (from outrage.01-v)
OUTRAGE-N NOTES: Added by Julia for unification.OUTRAGEOUS-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on WSJ data,outrage-v.01. (from outrageous.01-j)
OUTRAGED-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from outraged.01-j)

roleset.name: wild, over the top, possibly hilarious and wonderful

example.name: outrageous-j
example.text: That Chinese swimmer's hat is outrageous haha!

roleset.note: OUTRAGEOUS-J NOTES: Split from the original .01 roleset by Julia for unification.
